definition: to recommend (for admission to school)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: All students will be sent to ABRSM examination.
sentences.chinese: 所有学生保送报考英国皇家音乐试，成绩优异。

sentences.english: Wang allowed four runs, six hits and three walks in six innings .
sentences.chinese: 小民被得四分，六局中被打六支安打跟三个保送。

sentences.english: The Mets loaded the bases with two singles and a base on balls.
sentences.chinese: 麦兹队以两支安打和一次保送而占满垒。

sentences.english: They gave us two walks in one inning.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一局中给了我们两次保送上垒。

sentences.english: He doesn't walk people and he doesn't usually have high pitch counts.
sentences.chinese: 他也不太会保送打者，而且他的用球数通常不高。

sentences.english: I have sent the inquiry to determine, and bought a lot of books, let her study section .
sentences.chinese: 我已经确定保送上研了，给她买了很多书，让她考研。

sentences.english: Wakefield (4-5) walked five in five innings and served up both New York homers.
sentences.chinese: 在五局的投球中有5次保送，并被敲出全垒打。

sentences.english: Enrollment without requiring entrance examinations from candidates on recommendation is a special policy in enrollment system of higher learning institutions other than key universities.
sentences.chinese: 普通高枝招收免试保送生是招生制度的一项特殊政策。

sentences.english: Igawa's walks are down, as he has only four in eight innings .
sentences.chinese: 井川庆的保送有下降，他在八局中只有保送四次喔。

sentences.english: Igawa's walks are down, as he has only four in eight innings .
sentences.chinese: 井川庆的保送有下降，他在八局中只有保送四次喔。

sentences.english: In 2004, was recommended to the Central Conservatory of Music.
sentences.chinese: 2004年保送入中央音乐学院本部。

definition: to recommend sb for postgraduate studies/to admit for postgraduate studies without taking the entrance exam
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
graduate student/postgraduate student/research student
to pass a university entrance exam
abbr. for 清華大學|清华大学[Qing1 hua2 Da4 xue2]
to pursue one's studies
to gain entry by passing an exam/to be admitted to (a college etc)
undergraduate course/undergraduate (attributive)
to jump a year (at college)
to enter oneself for an examination
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
to pass an entrance exam/to be admitted to
top student
famous school
to pass entrance exam/to enter college after a competitive exam
scholarship/CL:筆|笔[bi3]
